timeline.bodyText:
Do we also need to prevent merging projects in RelBuilder when converting SqlNode to RelNode?
LogicalProject(EXPR$0=[ROW_NUMBER() OVER (ORDER BY ROW_NUMBER() OVER (ORDER BY $1 ROWS BETWEEN UNBOUNDED PRECEDING AND CURRENT ROW) ROWS BETWEEN UNBOUNDED PRECEDING AND CURRENT ROW)])
  JdbcTableScan(table=[[foodmart, product]])
timeline.author: DonnyZone

timeline.bodyText: What about we do not have any options for OVER , there would then has no reference for underlying inputs.
timeline.author: danny0405

replies.bodyText: I think ROW_NUMBER must have ORDER BY in its window, and if so, this concern is moot.
replies.author: julianhyde

timeline.author: danny0405

replies.bodyText: It is necessary - without it, there are failures in SqlToRelConverterTest.
replies.author: julianhyde

replies.bodyText: Yeah, you are right, it is not equivalent with the following block.
replies.author: danny0405

timeline.bodyText:
Is this true ? From the MS-SQL syntax, the ORDER BY has no relationship with <ROW or RANGE clause>, they can both exist separately. [1]
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/sql/t-sql/queries/select-over-clause-transact-sql?view=sql-server-ver15
timeline.author: danny0405

replies.bodyText:
How can you say '5 ROWS PRECEDING' if you don't provide an ORDER BY clause to say by which criteria they are preceding?
If rows/range are present and there is no ORDER BY the validator doesn't throw (maybe it should) but we treat all rows as equal.
replies.author: julianhyde

replies.bodyText:
I checked these for MS-SQL 2017
create table t(
  a int,
  b int
);

select max(a) over( rows 2 PRECEDING ) from t; -- syntax error throws
select max(a) over( order by b rows 2 PRECEDING ) from t; -- this works

select max(a) over(ROWS between UNBOUNDED PRECEDING and CURRENT ROW) from t; -- syntax error throws
select max(a) over(order by b ROWS between UNBOUNDED PRECEDING and CURRENT ROW) from t; -- this works
replies.author: danny0405

replies.bodyText: Show we throw for non-order by query ?
replies.author: danny0405

replies.bodyText: I have logged https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CALCITE-3897. We should decide whether we want to fix it.
replies.author: julianhyde

timeline.author: danny0405

replies.bodyText: I have the same question. If ImmutableList.of() is bad, then we should forbid its use, and move to Collections.emptyList().
replies.author: vlsi

replies.bodyText: See the commit comment. That parameter to scan is mutable, always has been. The implementation calls List.removeIf on it. As of guava-28.2-jre, removeIf throws even if the list is empty. So, these calls were incorrect to pass an immutable list.
replies.author: julianhyde

replies.bodyText: But it's not mutable. The contract calls to a mutable list.
replies.author: julianhyde

replies.bodyText:
If you think the contract is to treat the list as fully mutable, then, adjust the Javadoc, and adjust the implementation so it handles the mutations of the list.
In other words, for now you pass an ArrayList and expect it to be mutated. However, you seem to ignore the mutated value of the ArrayList, so the new code might result in invalid data being returned.
replies.author: vlsi

timeline.author: vlsi

replies.bodyText: No. We need a mutable list. Try running with -Pguava.version=28.2-jre and you will see.
replies.author: julianhyde

replies.bodyText:
Why do you think mutable list is required here?
It was working with ImmutableList.of(), so it means it should be perfectly fine to pass Collections.emptyList().
replies.author: vlsi

replies.bodyText: The javadoc says "the list of filters is mutable".
replies.author: julianhyde

replies.bodyText: javadoc does not say the implementation can add new filters to the list. So Collections.emptyList() is fine.
replies.author: vlsi

timeline.bodyText:
This is invalid because it does not verify if rows vs range is in its default value.
For instance,
count(x) over (order by x RANGE between unbounded preceding and current row) returns different values depending on RANGE vs ROW
timeline.author: vlsi

timeline.message:
[CALCITE-3876] RelToSqlConverter should not merge a Project that contains a window function that references a window function in input Project

Main fix is to RelToSqlConverter, to force a new sub-query to be created.

The problem in this case was not with ProjectMergeRule or with
RelBuilder.project, but I fixed those also.

[CALCITE-3877] In RexWindow, make fields upperBound and lowerBound not-nullable

Where you would previously have supplied null to RexBuilder.makeOver,
now supply RexWindowBounds.UNBOUNDED_PRECEDING,
RexWindowBounds.UNBOUNDED_FOLLOWING, or RexWindowBounds.CURRENT_ROW.

Move RexWindowBound.create into new class RexWindowBounds, with methods
and constants for the various types of bound.

Don't keep SqlNode inside RexWindowBound objects.

During validation, don't mutate the lowerBound and upperBound fields in
SqlWindow.

Note that "RANGE BETWEEN UNBOUNDED PRECEDING AND CURRENT ROW" is not
equivalent to "ROWS BETWEEN UNBOUNDED PRECEDING AND CURRENT ROW".
"RANGE BETWEEN UNBOUNDED PRECEDING AND UNBOUNDED FOLLOWING"
(that is, not bracket) is equivalent to
"ROWS BETWEEN UNBOUNDED PRECEDING AND UNBOUNDED FOLLOWING",
but we require RANGE, to keep things canonical.

Close apache/calcite#1896

[CALCITE-3814] Support JDK 14 and guava 28.2-jre

The real work for JDK 14 was done in c60f6750d "Update Gradle: 6.1.1 -> 6.3".

As of Gauava 28, ImmutableList.removeIf throws even if the list is empty
(and therefore no elements would be removed).

[CALCITE-3892] Make junit test classes and methods non-public where possible

Prior to junit 5, classes and methods had to be public. This is no
longer the case.

Some classes need to remain public because they are referenced from
elsewhere, or if they use reflection somehow. The remaining 'public'
keyword will be informative to maintainers.
